title.narrative: Support to the Africa programme of the Rights and Resources Initiative

description.narrative: The Rights and Resources Initiative (RRI) is a global coalition of 12 organizations for accelerating reforms in forest tenure and governance, policies and business models, mainly in developing countries (East and South Asia, West and Central Africa and Cen tral and South America). The purpose is to support processes directly benefiting the poor, by securing tenure rights of the local communities in respect of land, forests and other natural resources, and by strengthening the ability of the poor to excercise their rights, including benefits from the trade of wood and other forest products. In this respect, special emphasis in being laid on women and indigenous peoples. Finnish support is allocated to RRI Africa-programme in West and Central Africa.
